Name: 1 - Confirm Stormwater alignment is as per latest Drawing revision and does not clash with other Services.

STORMWATER PIPE INSTALLATION, BACKFILL AND TESTING
9 - Check actual horizontal and vertical alignment achieved
10 - Ensure pipe is checked & cleaned before being laid into the trench.
Comments: No vandalism, surface damage or deterioration. No install if found defective.
11 - Line, level, and grade conformance checked
12 - Ensure Bedding, surround & backfill materials are well-compacted and tested.
13 - Ensure installed pipeline has CCTV completed
Comments: No internal surface cracks. Clean from debris and contaminants.

Testing Quantity Required (based from schedule qtys) - Every Time
Detail - The Contractor shall take 3 sets of baselines readings from all instruments at 2 day intervals
Testing Quantity Required (based from schedule qtys) - Every 2 days
Detail - During active fill placement, the Contractor shall read all monitoring plates twice a week or every 1 metre of fill whichever is more frequent
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - To Engineer within 1 day of Reading
Testing Quantity Required (based from schedule qtys) - Twice a week
3.1.5 - Readings During No Active Earthworks in Area
Detail - The Contractor shall read all monitoring plates weekly if there is no active earthworks taking place in the area
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - To Engineer within 1 day of Reading
Testing Quantity Required (based from schedule qtys) - Weekly

Detail - The criteria for terminating the embankment preload are either: Three consecutive measurements indicating the t90 settlement value has been achieved, A rate of settlement less than 10% of the maximum rate measured immediately after the fill was completed. The settlement readings shall be evaluated by the Engineer to assess the need to extend the monitoring.
○ 3 Consecutive Measurements showing T90 settlement value achieved
○ Rate of settlement less than 10% of the maximum rate measured immediately after the fill was completed
Testing Quantity Required (based from schedule qtys) - Engineers Approval

Detail - The Contractor shall carry out compaction trials of the various soil types and combinations on site, and any imported fill materials, using different layer thicknesses, types of rollers and conditioning plant (ie construction discs and scarifiers). The trial details, test data and conclusions shall be reported and copied to the Engineer within five days of completion of each trial.

Prompting Name: DN1210-027-001 - ITP Streetlighting - Ducting and Cable installation

Name: SECTION 1 – MATERIAL, PERSONNEL & THIRD PARTY APPROVAL
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - Pothole all services prior to commencement of trenching. Suitably protect the existing services from construction damage.
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - Confirm on site the exact location of cabling routes before trenching.
○ Where connecting and or coordinating with existing services, engineers shall make local modifications necessary for the correct operation of the entire system.
Verifying Document - Survey data/Comms with Client
1.1.3 - Location of Lighting Poles, Cameras, Cable Pits and Montrose Boxes
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - Confirm with surveyor and mark out the exact locations of lighting poles, Cameras, Cable Pits and Montrose boxes before installation.
Verifying Document - Survey data/Comms with Client
Verifying Document - Coase Sand - PSD Report

Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - Under roads and paved areas: Coarse sand, controlled low strength material or fine crushed rock. In topsoil areas: Complete the backfilling with topsoil for at least the top 50mm.
Verifying Document - Material data sheet and engineers approval
Comments / Closeout Details - Backfill materials will either be site excavated GAP65 which had been approved at Earthwork stage) or Soil

Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - Use heavy duty HD PVC for underground services. Use best practice PVC where possible. Orange colour for all conduits containing consumer mains, sub-mains or final sub-circuits cabling
Verifying Document - Material data sheet and engineers approval
Comments / Closeout Details - Same power ducts applied as Utility works
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - Aco Cablemate Polycrete "type 66" Dimension: 665mm x 665mm x 620mm with heavy duty steel lid.
Verifying Document - Material data sheet and engineers approval
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - Keep trenches free of water
○ No sharp projections, roots and other obstructions.
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - Minimum 50mm separation from other conduits; Also follow separation requirements by utility operators when in shared trench.
○ Where services cross, install electrical conduit at the topmost
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - Seal buried entries of ducts and conduits using waterproof seals and/or conduit fittings.
○ Seal spare ducts and conduits immediately after installation and seal other ducts and conduits after cable installation.
